page.title: 12CHILHAM CASTLE-THE KEEP
page.content: Chilham Castle consists of two main buildings, the house and the Norman keep.The foundations of the Castle are Roman and Saxon.The Keep has four main floors.The first one is the basement, which is wrongly called the dungeon.The basement was used for storing food and weapons in case of a seige.They did not need to store water because there is a well in the keep which is one hundred feet deep. The water was pulled up by two donkeys.The second room is the Great Hall which was where the feasts were held.There is the solar where the constable lived and last is the state room where meetings were held.The house where the owner of the castle lives was built in 1616 and is not open to the public.
